translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Bhaddāli
“In the past I was a forest-dweller,
There I saw the Enlightened One,
Having left the forest for alms,
I gave it to the self-dependent one;
and by my intention and aspiration;
Having given up the human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.🔽Thirty-six times I was Sakka,
and thirty-three times I was a king,
this was the fruit of the patthodana.
Wandering in the world of becoming,
I have never been without wealth,
this is the fruit of my gift of a plough.
My wealth is like the flow of a river,🔽it is born and arises again.
I am unable to measure it,
this is the fruit of my gift of a plough.
this is the fruit of my gift of a plough.
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of my gift of a plough.
My defilements have been burned up,
Welcome indeed was it for me,
the instruction of the Buddha has been done.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā patthodanadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā patthodanadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: the instruction of the Buddha has been done.”🔽Thus the elder Patthodanadāyaka recited these verses.
The elder Patthodanadāyaka’s account is the ninth.
